result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua M Otto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to 22CM1469, 99 days credit for time served.

miscConds.notes: - Pay all court costs, fees, surcharges, including DNA, and restitution By 10-14-2023. Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment.

- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.
- No contact with I.L.C., Kohl's Department Store, Walmart.
- Write letter of apology to I.L.C.

- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua M Otto appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Joshua M Otto.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

As to Count 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed, but read-in for sentencing purposes.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 
As to Count 1: Defendant ordered to serve 8 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to 22CM1469, 99 days credit for time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 months with the following conditions:

Conditions of Probation
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.
- 45 hours of community service.
- No contact with I.L.C., Kohl's Department Store, Walmart. 
- Write letter of apology to I.L.C..
- Pay all court costs, fees, surcharges, including DNA, by 10-14-2023. Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment. 

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court.  Defendant Joshua M Otto in custody.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.
Case adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ILC

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Joshua M Otto in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Joshua M Otto in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joshua M Otto appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
